title: A Maths/Search Challenge For Anyone Willing
body:
For anyone game, comment below your answer to this problem:

Find the most possible damage that can be dealt among the champions of the League, with the below restrictions:

Choose One Champion, One Active Ability from that Champion^, and One Item
^since the champion is level 18, they have all their abilities, and thus will benefit from any other passive effects aside from the chosen active ability (such as Zed's Living Shadow AD% passive)

The Champion you choose is Level 18. You get to use one autoattack, the item's active ability once (if it has one), and the chosen ability once against a "punching bag" with *infinite health* and no damage modification stats/effects (like Armor/Magicres), so everything you do will essentially deal True Damage. These Three Actions may be done in any order, and any amount of time may be taken between the actions (to wait for "passive cooldowns" such as Sheen). The Punching Bag is the only target in range, and thus will be immediately targeted by passives such as Quinn's Harrier.

The Only Modifications that apply are the Item you choose, and any passives the champion has (increased stats etc.) No Runes/Masteries.

Damage dealt must not be variable - you cannot assume a critical hit. However, when considering abilities that deal the most damage based on differing areas, such as Ziggs' Mega Inferno Bomb, assume that the most possible damage is dealt.

Autoattack buffing abilites like Talon's Noxian diplomacy count as abilities and do not count as the one autoattack (so you get one autoattack plus the ability-empowered autoattack) Autoattack buffing passives that require stacks, such as Caitlyn's Headshot, are assumed to be at 0 stacks.

Abilities that deal more damage if the target is below a certain percentage of health (such as Zed's Passive) do not deal any bonus damage.

For Abilities that deal damage based on health percentage:
Abilities like Elise's Neurotoxin, that deal damage based on the target's maximum or current health, have the monster damage cap applied.
Abilities like Elise's Venomous Bite, that deal bonus damage based the target's missing health, don't deal any bonus damage.
*edited* Abilities that deal flat %hp damage, like Deathfire Grasp's active, deal no damage in this scenario.

Infinitely Stacking abilities like Nasus' Siphoning Strike would be assumed to be at 0 stacks.
Stacking Passives such as Tear of the Goddess and Casseopeia's Aspect of the Serpent can be assumed to have any number of stacks (up to the set maximum)
Sunfire Cape is not allowed as an item in this scenario.

Any other loophole effects/abilities that you discover please comment below. 

Happy Mathsing!

I actually think Nasus beats his brother on this one. Here's my attempt

Champion: Nasus

Item: The Bloodthirster

Activate Fury of the Sands, dealing 240 damage per second (as we use the capped value), for a total 3600 damage. Total Damage: 4029 damage (3600 Ability, 429 Basic Attack)

That's a lot.
Agreed, this is a good idea.

Couple questions:
Are we assuming the "punching bag" is counted as a minion/monster in all instances?
Do passives like (1) Quinn's Harrier, (2) Caitlyn's Headshot and (3) Lux's Illumination apply to the basic attack or would we have to pick their passive as the ability to do that (preferred each is answered separately as they act differently)?

I'm assuming we're not counting Gangplank's Parrrlay as a basic attack...

The punching bag is its own new, separate entity - it can be targeted by any spell and hit by any spell. I added that bit about the minion/monster cap so as to make calculation easier, and to avoid the "infinite damage" problem I've discussed above
Passives:
(1) Quinn's Harrier would proc on the only available target, so yes
(2) Caitlyn's Headshot would not count, as we assume only one autoattack is used (unless Caitlyn spawns with a charge ready?)
(3) Lux's Illumination would apply, as you choose the order of the spells, so R -> basic attack would be fine

Any passives the champion has, including the main one, do apply to the scenario - the one ability stipulation regards to one Activated ability.

Nope, Gangplank's Parrrley is an ability (that will proc on-hit effects, so double Sheen passive would be possible)
